newsitem.title: UK: Israel to launch debut Eurobond in early December.
newsitem.headline: Israel to launch debut Eurobond in early December.

text.p: Israel will launch its debut Eurobond in the first week of December, a syndicate official close to the deal said on Wednesday.
He said Israel would hold a roadshow starting in Frankfurt on November 27, moving to Tokyo on December 2, and hitting London on December 4. The formal launch would follow shortly thereafter.
The Eurobond was expected to be for $200-$300 million and have a maturity of between five and 10 years.

"The great thing is Israel doesn't really need the money and will be doing it to establish themselves in the international capital market with institutional investors," he said, adding there might be some retail follow-through.
"Israeli companies want to tap the international capital market and they will need a benchmark issue to go by," he added.
In September, Moody's Investors Service and Standard & Poor's Corp reaffirmed Israel's credit ratings of A3 and A- respectively.
"The peace process has gone forward over time and it is in everyone's best interests to go forward," an analyst said.
Merrill Lynch was awarded the mandate to lead manage the transaction in May this year. Israel was reported to want to raise $750 million over a three year period.
